item.title: Miguel's research page
item.description: About Me I am a PhD candidate of geophysics at the Georgia Institute of Technology where I study Seismology. My work focus on earthquake detection to swiftly analyze years of data and improve earthquake catalogs to get a better understanding of earthquake physics. My goal is to use the wealth of data in the earthquake catalogs to gain insights on earthquake nucleation, aftershock propagation and earthquake interactions in both interplate and intraplate regions.
